alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 4:14AM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON BELOW 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, snow, heavy at times. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, except 8 inches over the mountains. For the Winter Weather Advisory, periods of snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, the higher terrain of Central Douglas County, including the passes on I-5 south of Canyonville and Camas Mountain. For the Winter Weather Advisory, lower I-5 passes like Rice Hill, Marvin Hill and Roberts Mountain, but also Roseburg and Sutherlin and Elkton and Scottsburg. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and hazardous walking conditions are expected due to icy, snow covered roads and sidewalks. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
